analyzed: 'di ni bgegs kyi mtshan ma dang de rab tu bzlog pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o /

analyzed: rmi lam na ni 'phags rnams mthong dang dge slong bram ze mthong //

analyzed: yid ni dga' bar byed pa'i 'od chen khang par 'byung ba ste //

original: 'dir ni mtshan ma bzang //
analyzed: 'dir ni mtshan ma bzang //

analyzed: 'dir ni bzlas dang bsgom pa ji tsam gsal ba de nyid mchog /'di ni mtshan ma bzang po'i rab tu dbye ba'o /
translated: Here, the recitation and meditation are as clear as they are, and that is the best. This is the classification of the good signs.

analyzed: // / sman mchog bza' ba ma legs nges par dug tu 'gyur ba ltar //
translated: Just as the best medicine, when not properly consumed, will certainly become poison,

analyzed: dngos grub len mi mkhas pa rnams kyi dngos grub phyir phyogs pa'am //
translated: so too, for those who are unskilled in taking spiritual powers, spiritual powers turn into hindrances or

analyzed: yang na srog gi bar chad dag tu'ang 'gyur bas de yi phyir //
translated: even become obstacles to life. Therefore,

analyzed: mkhas pas dngos grub blang ba 'khrul pa med par shes par bya // rgya mtshor rin chen len pa rnams la 'tshe ba rnam mang 'byung //

analyzed: dngos grub rnams ni sgrub pa pos kyang bsrung bar rab tu dka' //
translated: The siddhis are very difficult to protect even for the adept.

analyzed: de bas blo ldan 'jigs pa ma lus ring du spangs pa yis //
translated: Therefore, the wise one, who has cast far away all fear,

analyzed: mi bzang mtshan ma ngan pa thams cad rab tu gzhig par bya //
translated: Should destroy all inauspicious and evil signs.

original: 'jigs par mi bya khrod dang chags pa rnam par spang par bya //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi bya khrod dang chags pa rnam par spang par bya //
translated: He should not be afraid, and should abandon attachment and aversion.

analyzed: mtshan bzangs rnams kyang sgyu ma 'dra bar blta bya ri rab bzhin //

analyzed: mtshan ma'i rlung gis nges par mi g-yo mnyam par gzhag par bya //
translated: He should be equipoised, not shaken by the winds of signs.

analyzed: de tshe de la lha mos yang dag zhal ston 'gyur ba ste //
translated: “At that time, the goddess will show her true face to him,

analyzed: thun mong ma yin bde ba 'byung 'gyur gus pas mchod cing bstod //
translated: And he should worship and praise her with devotion, for the arising of extraordinary bliss.

analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub gsol gdab yang dag gdams ngag don du 'gyur //
translated: He should request the desired siddhi, and the true instructions will be meaningful.

analyzed: ji srid gsung ba mi mnga' 'bad pas rab tu bsgrub par bya //
translated: He should strive to accomplish this as long as he does not hear the speech.🔽“

analyzed: gang tshe gsung pa mnga' ba de tshe gzhan la ltos dang bral //

analyzed: de ni lha mo'i sras yin bsam gyis mi khyab dbang dang ldan //
translated: He is the son of the Goddess, endowed with inconceivable power.

analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras po sgrib pa kun dang bral ba dpal ldan yin //
translated: The glorious one is the son of the Victorious One, free from all obscurations.

analyzed: de yis dngos grub dang ni mtshan ma gnyis ka ji srid du //
translated: As long as he has not been given both the signs and the powers,

original: gnang bar ma gyur de srid gzhan la zur tsam smra mi bya //
analyzed: gnang bar ma gyur de srid gzhan la zur tsam smra mi bya //
translated: he should not speak a word to anyone else.

original: skad cig de nyid la ni dngos grub ring 'gyur dran par bya //
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la ni dngos grub ring 'gyur dran par bya //
translated: He should remember that his powers will be far away in that very instant.

analyzed: grub par gyur nas sngags g-yog dang ni sgrub pa'i grogs mchog la //
translated: When he has attained powers, he should benefit the mantra servant and the best of practice assistants

original: dngos grub cha la ser sna bral bas sbyin bas phan gdags bya //🔽pha ma dang ni bla ma la yang dngos grub rdzas dag las //
analyzed: dngos grub cha la ser sna bral bas sbyin bas phan gdags bya // pha ma dang ni bla ma la yang dngos grub rdzas dag las //
translated: by giving them a share of the powers, free from the stinginess of avarice.🔽In the tantras it is explained that one should share the substances of powers

analyzed: chos mchog skal ba bgo bar rgyud rnams las ni rnam par bshad //
translated: with one’s father, mother, and guru, according to one’s good fortune in the supreme Dharma.

analyzed: mdor na dngos grub dag ni ji ltar bgo ba blo ldan gyis //
translated: In brief, the wise one should share the powers

analyzed: rgyud @321b rnams nyid las ji ltar bshad pa'i rjes 'brangs shes par bya //
translated: One should understand this in accordance with what is explained in the tantras themselves.

original: 'di ni dngos grub blang ba dang bgo ba'i rab tu dbye ba'o /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos grub blang ba dang bgo ba'i rab tu dbye ba'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the acceptance and distribution of the accomplishments.

translated: Those who have not obtained initiation into the supreme maṇḍala, those who do not keep the vows and pledges, those who transgress the guru’s words, and those who are mentally disrespectful to the guru,

analyzed: de bzhin sngon du bla ma dag la gus shing lkog na smod //

analyzed: sdug bsngal dag la bzod pa bskyed par mi nus sems stobs chung //

analyzed: cung zad smod tshig thos na rab tu mi dga' de bzhin du //

analyzed: stong nyid ston pa'i chos la sdang zhing dngos por 'dzin la dam //

analyzed: rang gis dpyad pas sngags tshul zab mo rnams la sdeb sbyor byed //
translated: They compose profound mantra methods through their own analysis.

analyzed: bla ma'i lung thob med par sngags rnams 'chad par kun du rtsom //

analyzed: bsnyen bkur dman zhing bla ma rnams la myur du man ngag 'dod //
translated: They desire the instructions from the gurus quickly, without proper service.

analyzed: dngos grub mi 'byung de dag phung po rnam par nyams par 'gyur //

translated: By this extensive explanation of the rite of meditation,🔽May all beings quickly reach

translated: The state of liberation from the ocean of existence.
